entry.title: Organic Baby Lima Beans
entry.summary:
Vendor: OnlineOrganics
Type: Pulses (Beans, Lentils & Peas)
Price: 77.81

Our organic baby lima beans are naturally low in calories, but full of healthy complex carbohydrates. Baby lima beans are sometimes called butter beans because of their rich, buttery taste or less commonly junior lima beans.

They contain high amounts of fiber and may help reduce the rise in blood sugar that happens after a meal. They are also a great replacement for meat as a source of vegan protein.

 

What is the difference between Lima and Baby Lima Beans?

  • Other than the obvious size difference which the name implies, lima beans are yellow and baby lima beans are green when cooked.
  • Nutrition wise they are identical and there is no overall better one.



Storage Tips:

  • Nothing beats vacuum sealing for freshness.
  • Store below 15°C and < 65% humidity.
  • Store in the dark as light degrades flavors.
  • Mason jars make great storage containers.
  • Can be frozen to prolong shelf life.

entry.title: Organic Black Beluga Lentils
entry.summary:
Vendor: OnlineOrganics
Type: Pulses (Beans, Lentils & Peas)
Price: 164.25

Our organic black beluga lentils are named for the caviar they amazingly resemble. They are inexpensive, easy to cook, protein-packed, and delicious. Unlike other lentils that tend to get mushy when cooked, beluga lentils hold their shape and al dente texture during the cooking process.

A staple ingredient in many recipes throughout Asia and the Mediterranean, black beluga lentils are packed with protein, fiber, and antioxidants. As a matter of fact, when compared to 10 other legumes, lentils come out on top for antioxidant content.

Though they are tiny, black beluga lentils provide a mighty dose of nutrition in every single bite!

Locally grown in Canada, buying our organic black beluga lentils encourages local farmers and reduces pollution from long-distance transportation.



Storage Tips:

  • Nothing beats vacuum sealing for freshness.
  • Store below 15°C and < 65% humidity.
  • Store in the dark as light degrades flavors.
  • Mason jars make great storage containers.
  • Can be frozen to prolong shelf life.

entry.title: Organic French Lentils
entry.summary:
Vendor: OnlineOrganics
Type: Pulses (Beans, Lentils & Peas)
Price: 149.27

Our organic french lentils are a dark green color, and their taste is similar to that of green peas.

The distinguishing feature of French lentils is their very high content of fiber and protein. The latter constitutes about 30% of the whole content of this legume. Additionally, they are a rich source of essential minerals, amino acids, and B-complex vitamins. Due to this composition, French lentils are beneficial for many systems and organs.

French green lentils do not require soaking, and they are also more resistant to falling apart while being cooked.

Locally grown in Canada, buying our organic french lentils encourages local farmers and reduces pollution from long-distance transportation.



Storage Tips:

  • Nothing beats vacuum sealing for freshness.
  • Store below 15°C and < 65% humidity.
  • Store in the dark as light degrades flavors.
  • Mason jars make great storage containers.
  • Can be frozen to prolong shelf life.

entry.title: Organic White Kidney Beans
entry.summary:
Vendor: OnlineOrganics
Type: Pulses (Beans, Lentils & Peas)
Price: 74.74

Our organic white kidney beans are also referred to as Cannellini beans or fazolia beans. They have a firm, ivory colored skin, creamy texture and mild flavor. This type of kidney bean is a good recipe add-in for dishes that have a relatively short cooking time. The texture of these beans enables them to absorb flavors well. This makes them a good choice of bean to include in chili or soup recipes. They can also used in salads and as a healthy side dish.

White kidney beans contain high amounts of fiber and may help reduce the rise in blood sugar that happens after a meal. They are also a great replacement for meat as a source of vegan protein.

Kidney beans are a good source of several vitamins and minerals, such as molybdenum, folate, iron, copper, manganese, potassium, and vitamin K1. They have remarkably low carbon and water footprint, making them an environmentally-friendly choice.

Did you know that kidney beans got their name for their visual resemblance in shape and color to a kidney?

 

What is the difference between Dark Red and White Kidney Beans?

  • Dark red kidney beans have a slightly nutty, somewhat more prominent flavor than the white kidney bean.
  • Dark red kidney beans are better suited for slowly cooked receipes (chillis, vegtable stews, etc) as they take much more time to cook than white kidney beans.
  • Nutrition wise they are nearly identical and there is no overall better one.



Storage Tips:

  • Nothing beats vacuum sealing for freshness.
  • Store below 15°C and < 65% humidity.
  • Store in the dark as light degrades flavors.
  • Mason jars make great storage containers.
  • Can be frozen to prolong shelf life.

entry.title: Organic Black Eyed Peas Beans
entry.summary:
Vendor: OnlineOrganics
Type: Pulses (Beans, Lentils & Peas)
Price: 71.68

Our organic black eyed peas beans make a yummy side dish and a hearty addition to any soup or stew. Despite their name, black-eyed peas are not peas but rather a type of bean.

Black-eyed peas are incredibly nutrient-dense, packing plenty of fiber and protein into each serving. They’re also a good source of several important micronutrients, including folate, copper, thiamine, and iron.

 

Did you know?

When Will. I. Am first came up with the name that would rule over music charts he wanted a name that represented nourishment, and he took a cue from one of his favorite bands The Red Hot Chili Peppers and came up with the Black-Eyed Peas.



Storage Tips:

  • Nothing beats vacuum sealing for freshness.
  • Store below 15°C and < 65% humidity.
  • Store in the dark as light degrades flavors.
  • Mason jars make great storage containers.
  • Can be frozen to prolong shelf life.

entry.title: Organic Adzuki Beans
entry.summary:
Vendor: OnlineOrganics
Type: Pulses (Beans, Lentils & Peas)
Price: 71.22

Our organic adzuki beans (Chinese red beans) are the leguminous fruit-pods of a plant originally from Asia. The beans occupy a significant cultural importance in the oriental cuisine. The red-colored beans were believed to have the effect of suppressing negative emotions and bad luck.

Adzuki beans are one of the important sources of plant proteins. In addition, adzuki compose wide range of minerals like for being low in calcium to high levels of iron, manganese, phosphorus, and potassium. Potassium is essential electrolyte of cell and body fluids. It helps counter pressing effects of sodium on heart and blood pressure. The human body uses manganese as a co-factor for the important antioxidant enzyme, superoxide dismutase.

Adzuki beans contain lots of dietary fiber. Dietary fiber works as a bulk laxative that helps to protect the colon mucosa by decreasing its exposure time to toxic substances as well as by binding to cancer-causing chemicals in the colon. Dietary fiber has also been shown to reduce blood cholesterol levels by decreasing reabsorption of cholesterol binding bile acids in the colon.



Storage Tips:

  • Nothing beats vacuum sealing for freshness.
  • Store below 15°C and < 65% humidity.
  • Store in the dark as light degrades flavors.
  • Mason jars make great storage containers.
  • Can be frozen to prolong shelf life.

entry.title: Organic Whole Green Peas
entry.summary:
Vendor: OnlineOrganics
Type: Pulses (Beans, Lentils & Peas)
Price: 5.90 - 107.23 (2 variants)

Our organic whole green peas contain just about every vitamin and mineral you need, in addition to a significant amount of fiber. One serving of peas contains as much as Vitamin C as two large apples. The less water you use when cooking peas, the less vitamin C is lost. The unique protein content of green peas makes them an excellent food choice for those who do not eat animal products.

Locally grown in Canada, buying our organic whole green peas encourages local farmers and reduces pollution from long-distance transportation.



Storage Tips:

  • Nothing beats vacuum sealing for freshness.
  • Store below 15°C and < 65% humidity.
  • Store in the dark as light degrades flavors.
  • Mason jars make great storage containers.
  • Can be frozen to prolong shelf life.

entry.title: Organic Split Yellow Peas
entry.summary:
Vendor: OnlineOrganics
Type: Pulses (Beans, Lentils & Peas)
Price: 6.07 - 121.25 (2 variants)

Our organic split yellow peas cook quickly without the need for soaking. Split yellow peas tend to fall apart when thoroughly cooked, lending a thickening quality to stews, soups and curries.

A half-cup serving of cooked split peas provides 110 calories, 10 grams of protein (20% of the daily value), less than one gram of fat and 12 grams of dietary fiber. That’s almost half the daily value of 28 grams of fiber, which most people don’t get daily!

Locally grown in Canada, buying our organic split yellow peas encourages local farmers and reduces pollution from long-distance transportation.



Storage Tips:

  • Nothing beats vacuum sealing for freshness.
  • Store below 15°C and < 65% humidity.
  • Store in the dark as light degrades flavors.
  • Mason jars make great storage containers.
  • Can be frozen to prolong shelf life.

entry.title: Organic Soybeans
entry.summary:
Vendor: OnlineOrganics
Type: Pulses (Beans, Lentils & Peas)
Price: 6.07 - 121.50 (2 variants)

Our organic soybeans are high in protein and a decent source of both carbs and fat. They are a rich source of various vitamins, minerals, and beneficial plant compounds, such as isoflavones. For this reason, regular soybean intake may alleviate the symptoms of menopause and reduce your risk of prostate and breast cancer.

They are an important component of Asian diets and have been consumed for thousands of years. Today, they are mainly grown in Asia and South and North America. Soy beans contain antioxidants and phytonutrients that are linked to various health benefits.

Locally grown in Canada, buying our organic soybeans encourages local farmers and reduces pollution from long-distance transportation.



Storage Tips:

  • Nothing beats vacuum sealing for freshness.
  • Store below 15°C and < 65% humidity.
  • Store in the dark as light degrades flavors.
  • Mason jars make great storage containers.
  • Can be frozen to prolong shelf life.

entry.title: Organic Red Split Lentils
entry.summary:
Vendor: OnlineOrganics
Type: Pulses (Beans, Lentils & Peas)
Price: 8.21 - 74.63 (2 variants)

Our organic red split lentils are a very good source of cholesterol-lowering fiber. Not only do lentils help lower cholesterol, they help managing blood-sugar disorders since their high fiber content prevents blood sugar levels from rising rapidly after a meal.

Lentils do not require any soaking and can be cooked right away. A 3/4 cup of cooked lentils provides more potassium than a large banana along with 13 grams of protein. Lentils also contain more folate than any other plant food.

  • Store below 15°C and < 65% humidity.
  • Store in the dark as light degrades flavors.
  • Mason jars make great storage containers.
  • Can be frozen to prolong shelf life.

entry.title: Organic Pinto Beans
entry.summary:
Vendor: OnlineOrganics
Type: Pulses (Beans, Lentils & Peas)
Price: 7.49 - 68.04 (2 variants)

Our organic pinto beans contain the most fiber of all beans & they are an excellent source of protein. Pinto beans are also a great source of phytates, a cancer fighting super hero.

A variety of the common bean "phaseolus vulgaris" pinto beans are the second most popular vegetable plants (right after tomatoes) for growing in the home garden. They are frequently used in Mexican cuisine whole or mashed.

entry.title: Organic Navy Beans
entry.summary:
Vendor: OnlineOrganics
Type: Pulses (Beans, Lentils & Peas)
Price: 8.58 - 78.04 (2 variants)

Our organic navy beans provide a virtually fat-free high quality protein. A one cup serving of navy beans provides 24% of the daily recommended intake for iron. They are also a great replacement for meat as a source of vegan protein.

Get your vegan cooking on with a delicious vegan chili from organic navy beans, pinto beans, kidney beans, green lentils, & red split lentils!

Did you know that navy beans got their current popular name because it was a staple food of the United States Navy in the early 20th century?

entry.title: Organic Chickpeas
entry.summary:
Vendor: OnlineOrganics
Type: Pulses (Beans, Lentils & Peas)
Price: 6.42 - 128.50 (3 variants)

Our organic chickpeas are high in protein and make an excellent replacement for meat in vegetarian and vegan diets. They’re the main ingredient in hummus, which is a dip made with mashed chickpeas, tahini (sesame seed paste), olive oil, lemon juice, salt and garlic.

Chickpeas are versatile and can be used in a variety of dishes. One popular way to eat them is by adding them to salads, soups or sandwiches. Another way to enjoy chickpeas is to roast them, which makes for a delicious and crunchy snack. You can also incorporate them into veggie burgers or tacos.

 

What is the difference between Chick peas and Garbanzo beans?

  • The name chickpea comes from the Latin word cicer, referring to the plant family of legumes, Fabaceae. This is how most people refer to this product around the globe.
  • Its popular Spanish-derived name is the garbanzo bean. This name is popular in Hispanic communities.
  • When it comes down to the actual product, it is the exact same thing.



Storage Tips:

  • Nothing beats vacuum sealing for freshness.
  • Store below 15°C and < 65% humidity.
  • Store in the dark as light degrades flavors.
  • Mason jars make great storage containers.
  • Can be frozen to prolong shelf life.

entry.title: Organic Black Turtle Beans
entry.summary:
Vendor: OnlineOrganics
Type: Pulses (Beans, Lentils & Peas)
Price: 7.84 - 71.34 (2 variants)

Our organic black turtle beans have high levels of flavonoids, particularly anthocyanin, which have antioxidant abilities. They also contain omega-3 fatty acid, which is considered a good form of cholesterol. Black beans are a great source of folic acid and have abnormally high levels of the rare compound molybdenum, which is very difficult to find in any other food.

They are very popular among vegetarians because when they are combined with brown rice, a complete protein meal is formed.

They are also versatile, cholesterol free, high in fiber (15 grams per cooked cup), rich in protein (15.24 grams per cooked cup) and low in fat (less than a gram a fat per cooked cup).



Storage Tips:

  • Nothing beats vacuum sealing for freshness.
  • Store below 15°C and < 65% humidity.
  • Store in the dark as light degrades flavors.
  • Mason jars make great storage containers.
  • Can be frozen to prolong shelf life.
